Comprehensive Average Daily Feed Intake (ADFI) Calculation Pipeline

Source: R/adfi_get.R
adfi_get.Rd

Integrated system for calculating porcine average daily feed intake (ADFI) through error detection, correction, and imputation. Processes and calibrates feed intake data from feeding stations.

adfi_get(data, adg_res, station_type = NULL, quiet = FALSE)

Arguments

data

A data.table or data.frame containing feed intake records

adg_res

Result list from adg_get() function containing ADG information

station_type

Character. Type of feeding station: "nedap" or "fire". If NULL, will auto-detect from data structure.

quiet

Logical. If TRUE, suppresses messages and warnings. Default: FALSE.

Value

A list containing:

  • adfi_info:

    • Aggregated feed intake metrics data.table

    • Contains columns: responder, location, origin_dfi, corrected_dfi

  • adfi_data:

    • Detailed daily feed intake data.table

    • Contains columns: responder, location, date, seq_days, origin_dfi, corrected_dfi, state

    • State indicators: "org" (original), "corr" (corrected), "iii" (interpolated), "elrp" (extrapolated)

Details

Processing Workflow:

  1. Error Detection:

    • Generates error variables based on station type

    • Identifies feed intake anomalies through predefined thresholds

    • Flags problematic records for correction

  2. Error Correction:

    • Calculates error proportions by animal and day

    • Separates valid vs. error-containing intake records

    • Applies LMM modeling for calibration of error feeds

  3. ADFI Calculation:

    • Combines corrected and valid intake records

    • Performs temporal imputation for missing data points

    • Calculates average daily feed intake metrics

Supported Station Types:

  • NEDAP: Processes responder, location, date, and state-based data

  • FIRE: Processes entrancetime/exittime and weight-based feeding data

See also

  • adg_get() For average daily gain calculation

Examples

result_nedap <- preprocess_data(data = mintyr::nedap, station_type = "nedap", quiet = TRUE)
adg_result <- adg_get(result_nedap, my_break = c(30,120), quiet = TRUE)
adfi_result <- adfi_get(result_nedap, adg_result, quiet = TRUE)
head(adfi_result$adfi_info)
#>    responder location origin_dfi corrected_dfi
#>       <char>   <char>      <num>         <num>
#> 1:     13913      101   2535.959      2560.189
#> 2:     13918      101   2319.814      2307.572
#> 3:     13935      102   2703.371      2704.603
#> 4:     13954      101   2317.260      2307.228
#> 5:     13996      101   2909.309      2921.705
#> 6:     14260      102   2846.546      2822.715
head(adfi_result$adfi_data)
#> Key: <responder, seq_days>
#>    responder location       date seq_days origin_dfi corrected_dfi  state
#>       <char>   <char>     <Date>    <int>      <int>         <num> <char>
#> 1:     13913      101 2024-02-19        1          1      896.8517   elrp
#> 2:     13913      101 2024-02-20        2        677      677.0000    org
#> 3:     13913      101 2024-02-21        3        661      661.0000    org
#> 4:     13913      101 2024-02-22        4        869      869.0000    org
#> 5:     13913      101 2024-02-23        5       1046     1046.0000    org
#> 6:     13913      101 2024-02-24        6        998      998.0000    org
